intro: Keetia leucantha, commonly known as the white keetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Keetia leucantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
